definition: to announce the winners in a lottery

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: That's for sure. I am betting on my lucky number again.
sentences.chinese: 我在猜，你大概也很想知道每天的彩票開獎號碼了？

sentences.english: Lotto night comes and Babbette still has no luck.
sentences.chinese: 樂透開獎的夜晚來臨了，但芭芘特還是沒有運氣。

sentences.english: When"row preface type" draws lottery in public machine, the lottery ticket number is directly these numbers.
sentences.chinese: 在“排序型”開獎機時，彩票號碼直接是這些數字。

sentences.english: Lotto night comes and somebody else wins it.
sentences.chinese: 樂透開獎的晚上，別人把獎贏走了。

definition: as if gaining the most precious treasure
to direct a television or radio broadcast/director (TV, radio)
open ball (math.)/to start a ball game/to kick off (soccer)/to tee off (golf)
live relay/broadcast of actual scene/to broadcast live
lit. to besiege 魏[Wei4] and rescue 趙|赵[Zhao4] (idiom)/fig. to relieve a besieged ally by attacking the home base of the besiegers
Water Margin or Outlaws of the Marsh by Shi Nai'an 施耐庵[Shi1 Nai4 an1], one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature
